concept.title: When to Use Serialization
concept.shortdesc: Region data in many scenarios must be serializable. You can store your data in the cache in serialized or deserialized form, depending on how you use it.

conbody.p: Region data in many scenarios must be serializable. You can store your data in the cache in serialized or deserialized form, depending on how you use it.

ul.li: Partitioned regions, with one exception: functions that add data to a partitioned region locally use the deserialized form.
Regions that are persisted or overflowed to disk
Server or client regions in a client/server installation
Regions distributed between gateways in a multi-site installation
Regions that receive events from remote caches
Regions that provide function arguments and results

conbody.p: To minimize the cost of serialization and deserialization, GemFire avoids changing the data format whenever possible. This means you can store your data in the cache in serialized or deserialized form, depending on how you use it. For example, if a server acts only as a storage location for data distribution between clients, it makes sense to leave the data in serialized form, ready to be transmitted to clients that request it.
